page.title: 10HISTORY OF SOUTH GODSTONE
page.content: In 1841 the{Dover and Chatham {Railway Company}opened the Redhill to Tonbridge line. As a result South Godstone grew around the Dover public house, now known as the Railway Hotel. The village is within the old deer park of Lagham Manor. Because of a growing population a small schoolroom was built in 1869. This was{Godstone Station School}which was made available for public worship. The station school was enlarged from time to time as new residential properties were developed. In 1939 evacuees and their teachers from Brockley shared the school with local children. In July 1959 Godstone Station school closed and a new Church School opened in Hunters Chase. The old school became St.Stephen's Church.
